this.$debug
If debug is true, this will be the jQuery object for the visible rectangle.
We keep track of whether the tabs are hidden in this (internal) variable so we still have access to that information during the window’s unload event, when window.Tabs no longer exists.

Initializes the object.

Called by a subclass when its bounds change, to update the debugging rectangles on screen.
The Tabs tab that represents the active tab in the active window.

dropPos,

callback)

eventName,
callback)
The given callback will be called when the Subscribable fires the given event.

bounds,
options)
Arranges the given items in a grid within the given bounds, maximizing item size but maintaining standard tab aspect ratio for each

The position and size of this Item, represented as a Rect.

When set to true, displays a rectangle on the screen that corresponds with bounds.

Repaints the thumbnail with the given resolution, and forces it to stay that resolution until unforceCanvasSize is called.

Returns the active group.
getActiveTab: function()

Returns a copy of the Item’s bounds as a Rect.

Returns the nth child tab or null if index is out of range.

Returns an array of all tabs that aren’t in a group
getPageBounds: function()
Returns a Rect defining the area of the page Items should stay within.
getTopLevelItems: function()
Returns an array of all Items not grouped into groups.

Returns an array of the tabs which are currently visibible in the tab bar.

Returns the zIndex of the Item.
